intro: Gypsophila rokejeka, commonly known as the mountain flax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Gypsophila rokejeka is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
